title: Angry user
text: I recently upgraded your app and lost 4 or more years of data that I used to do time cards or just look back at where I‚Äôve been even though I had my app preferences set to while using app , it was working fine for me like that , now it seems you , google maps are punishing me for not letting you SPY on my whereabouts 24-7. I like your app actually love your app I don‚Äôt think I should be penalized for not letting you watch me 24-7 , it should be my choice not yours. Why do you need this info anyway? I don‚Äôt need you to suggest anything for me if I want to know something I google it , I you tube it I wiki it what are you people after? Give me back my data you took and my choice to let you watch me.

title: Rerouting defaults to Accept New Route, dangerous
text: The major problem with Google Maps on iPhone is that when the app finds a new route, whether due to traffic, or a shorter/faster route, it forces you to tap Dismiss within a few seconds, or it defaults to the new route. So if you‚Äôve chosen from the available routes before starting directions, it will still force switch to why it believes is the ‚Äúbetter‚Äù route. If you wish to keep your chosen route, you have to take your eyes off the road, hands off the wheel, open the phone, navigate to the app, then press the Dismiss button. Dangerous. If you‚Äôre on a motorcycle, impossible. Searching online, I see that this is an EXTREMELY common complaint. It seems clear and logical that the default should be to keep your existing route, with an option to Accept the new route. Hopefully Google will listen and change this.

title: Transit departures widget
text:
I've been getting a ton of use out of this widget. Living in NYC, it's amazing to have bus arrival times available in real time without having to rely on the MTA or poke around inside the app. Just this past weekend, the widget picked up that a bus was 4 minutes away, when the MTA said it was 14 minutes away! 

My big suggestion to make this widget even better would be to have the ability 'pin' your most used transit options so it's not necessarily location based. For example, my closest subway station is 3 blocks away, so my phone doesn't list it as an option for me. 

If I had a subway countdown clock available in my widgets at all times, that would significantly improve my commute!

title: Do the most unqualified engineers work on this?
text:
Google maps has consistently failed to work properly in a variety of places, from New York City to Berlin. 

Typically, when someone writes a one star review, they tend to exaggerate problematic aspects of the app to suit a narrative. However, here, no exaggeration is needed.

When driving in New York, google maps is unable to distinguish between driving on overpasses vs the streets underneath. If I‚Äôm going 40+mph, would I be going in the local streets with stop signs? 

What happened to all the machine learning? Wouldn‚Äôt you be able to distinguish, with the vast amount of data that you have collected, the difference between someone driving in a local vs high speed overpass?

In Berlin, the app has consistently failed to map out correctly where to take public transportation. It creates fantasy routes, going through buildings and towers, impossible to follow and to use.

So, this brings me to the question: who is working on this? What are these ‚Äúengineers‚Äù doing? Engineers: if your natural inclination is to ‚Äúsolve problems‚Äù, know that you have solved few and created many. Congratulations on being able to do minimal spanning trees or topological sorts, but know that in reality this is utterly useless. Your computer science knowledge is applicable in a vacuum, useless, and creates more problems and no solutions, and you should be deeply ashamed.

title: Sayed Ali - Kia of Riverdale, New Jersey
text:
Syed Ali is the best professional car salesmen I have ever worked with!! His word is gold, and his caring and kindness is above, and beyond amazing, and heart warming! I searched the entire country for a very specific car, after my car was totaled, and I live in CA. After spending 2 weeks I found exactly what I wanted in New Jersey at the Kia dealer in Riverdale. I called and Ali answered and took my obsession with this car seriously, as there were several customers interested. Two days later, thanks to Ali, my car was shipped to CA yesterday and I am beyond grateful to Sayed Ali, because without him it would never have come together for me!!
Thank you from the bottom of my heart Sayed Ali!!!
Heidi ONeal

title: Great customer service
text:
These guys rock! They got my Jeep in right away because really needed some work on the brakes an asked them to do an oil change as well. They found a few minor things wrong, and called whenever they came across something and would give recommendations but were not overly pushy about it being done the entire staff was very courteous and understanding about our financial situation. The bill was slightly  pricey but you will definitely get what you pay for with these Guys! I highly recommend this shop to anybody looking for spectacular service and to know your vehicle will be in good hands. Thank you guys again! 

-Cade and Kendahl
(The newlyweds)

title: Google doesn‚Äôt listen
text: For six months I have repeatedly reported this issue through the app and it looks like I could continue the rest of my life without getting it fixed. If you navigate to my home, Google Maps will guide you to the street behind my house and end there, showing a dotted line where you would walk through someone else‚Äôs property, climb a privacy fence into my backyard. I have tried entering other addresses on my block my street and it does the same thing for each and every one of them. Somehow in googles mapping program they have seemed to omitted the option to drive down my street unless you‚Äôre leaving it. I obviously know my way home but when I have deliveries or first time visitors definitely creates confusion. GOOGLE, PLEASE PAY ATTENTION!

title: Is Google Map the new Facebook?
text: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I like Facebook however, the current state of the platforms doesn‚Äôt really provide useful information but providing a place for grouping . I miss the old day when you find useful information and interesting people on FB. Google Map is different but yet resinate to users a similar way. One can share cool new places that they discover and try out. Furthermore, share their experiences about these places and help attract more customers for the local. On top of that, it doesn‚Äôt alway have to be a business. A cool hiking trail, a beautiful park, one can also share their experiences about their activities and so more. I will have to say Google Map is the new FB.

title: Has come a long way
text: App is working really well these days. A lot of the newer features are really handy, like sharing location. The most efficient route, indicated by the green leaf, is so cool. One hour-long route I typically take (fastest), is also not efficient. For a six minute longer drive time, I can save 12% in fuel on the trip using a different route - awesome! My only complaint right now is that I cannot upload spherical photos (aka PhotoSpheres) within the iOS app. They aren‚Äôt recognized once uploaded. I have to upload them through the web browser instead for them to be recognized. I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll fix that eventually, especially since it is the current recommendation (use the mobile app).

title: Rescued
text: I was on my way to enjoy my vacation when suddenly my engine blew on I-4 between Daytona Beach and Orlando. Needless to say, I had to have my vehicle towed all the way back to Jacksonville and quickly figure out what kind of transportation I could find before the following week. Coggin came to the rescue! I saw a flyer that I received in the mail from Capital One about being pre-approved for a vehicle and for some reason, I hadn‚Äôt thrown it away. I called the number and went to Coggin Chevrolet at the Avenues. When I got there, Andrew Dove assisted me and a few hours later, I was leaving the lot with my BMW 550i! Mr. Dove and the staff took care of me and made sure that I was satisfied in all aspects. It was a good sales experience that was stress free!

title: Needs minor improvements
text:
Overall I prefer Google maps, especially now that I can use it with carplay. However, some small changes would make it even better. I'd like to have a watch app that alerts me of upcoming turns, like Apple maps does. I would also like to know when an intersection where I'll be making a turn is a stoplight. Just some things to make it even more user friendly.

Update: Still would really like to have the watch integration, that's something I do like about using apple maps. Using Google has been fine around where I live, but has had some problems on longer drives. Recently, Waze was able to save me 45 minutes by finding an alternate route around a wreck when Google insisted the fastest way was to wait it out in traffic. Not thrilled with this app lately.

title: Boo!! 5.4 is broken!
text:
So I updated the app this morning and actually needed it this afternoon. I mapped the route fine from my starting point, but as I drove, it started drifting way off. I put me about a mile to the north of the actual route. I had full LTE and was out in the open. I‚Äôve used google maps along this similar routing before and never had an issue. Used to work just fine. I just don‚Äôt get why developers have to make tweaks to an already working, functional app and then break something that was actually useful. 

I tried closing the app and opening it again, but it still showed me way off. So, I opened Waze, and it worked beautifully. Just like a GPS map app should. Google Maps used to be my go to for directions, but not anymore. At least not this version. I did notice that the update had a more cartoonish look to the map and the UI. Dumb. 

I‚Äôd attach a screenshot or two, but the review won‚Äôt let me.

title: Firemen Dryermen dryer vent cleaning
text:
Had our dryer vents cleaned by this group. These are firemen who started this company to clean out dryer vents that could cause fires. 
Had a great experience from the start. Brett was very friendly and professional on the phone when I called. We set an appointment and then I got a text and email to confirm. I got another reminder text the day before. 
Phar was the tech that came out. He too was very friendly and professional. He cleaned out the vents on our roof and then vacuumed the dryer interior. 
Wow!  What a difference it made in drying our clothes!
This is one of the few companies that cleans the roof vents.  I highly recommend them to get your vents cleaned out, improve the function of your dryer and prevent any possible fires.

title: Great app
text: I appreciate this great app! Thank you!! Is there a way to save where you parked your vehicle and get directions to find it again? Can you make one? Is there a way to save a route you took that wasn‚Äôt exactly the way the map took you? Can you make that? Is there a way to save a place you stopped at and where it is so you can find it again and add it to the route you took to get there and when coming back the other way home to take that route and find that place again? Can you make that, please? Thank you for everything! I would love to be able to take the same route home and have those directions.

title: Great Experience!
text:
Every aspect of our patio door system replacement was positive!
Our 1964 original 8-foot patio door system had become mostly non-usable due to the roller system. Our handyman didn‚Äôt want to tackle it, so we got an estimate from another company last year. Decided this year to call Bee. Every step of the process from the estimate to installation was timely, professional, and top quality. We were kept informed/updated of the materials progress and installation was before the projected date. The installers (Tyler & Jordan) did an excellent job and were prompt, professional, informative, hard-working & friendly. 
Would definitely recommend Bee!

title: Latest Update is Trash
text:
The only reason this app has such a high rating right now is because at least 70% of the good reviews were made by bots and contain content that has nothing to do with the app. Likely done so that their reviews don‚Äôt tank after this update broke the app. It really messed up navigation and I can‚Äôt fully trust the app to get me where I need to go.

There have been multiple instances where the app has shown me going in a different direction than the one I was going in. It freezes, forcing me to restart the app once I realize it‚Äôs no longer working and that I passed my exit 5 miles ago. It used to warn me when I was about 2 miles from a turn or exit, but now it either warns me right before or immediately after. I‚Äôll likely switch to a different navigation app until this one is fixed.

title: Personalized Magnificence
text: Google Maps is not only the informative, intelligent navigation app we love but also such an ingenious way of enhancing personal experiences throughout everyone‚Äôs lives. Reviews inform people of what to expect before they ever leave home. Google Maps incorporates this into everything around us with location-sharing: when you visit somewhere public, Maps asks you what you thought of the place. With kudos, levels and updates, Google Maps motivates everyone to contribute more and more. This is an amazing way to involve everyone, and gather the most helpful information; information from the people, for the people.  Google just gets better and better.

title: Getting better but ....
text:
Of course it's the only good one there is. Unfortunately very often not accurate. I had problems recently in NYC. In NJ driving. Got lost too many times. And in Europe not very reliable. Still better than competition so keep improving. Also very non intuitive usage. Especially if you are looking outside of your area. Too many steps to get there. E. G. Was looking to find places in southern China. Impossible to quickly getting there. And remains imprecise And of course the privacy issues. Unacceptable but no one seems to care here. No wonder EU are looking so closely. We are here too lenient
Again. Accuracy is really that‚Äôs missing. Just yesterday I was looking for Amelia island and was directed to an area NW of Miami ridiculous 
And you want to lead with such mistakes. Get real

title: Recent trips have been misleading and inefficient
text: I love Google Maps, but recently the app has been just awful and inconsistent. The app has been unable to keep an accurate location of my phone, causing the routes to drastically change (example: I‚Äôll be following the route via highway, and suddenly the app will re-track me to use a local route, and switch again 3 more times). I recently was taking a route to a suburb, and the route told me not to take the highway that leads me there. I thought this was strange but thought that perhaps there was traffic, and trusted the app to get me there another way. But when we failed to take that highway, the route randomly changed and added 15 minutes to my trip without any notification. This has been very frustrating because I am a huge proponent of Google Maps over other apps (under recently). Please fix whatever issues that are causing the app‚Äôs inaccuracy.

title: What happened to my most reliable app!?
text:
As a trucker i rely on google maps for more than 10 hours each day and until recently it was a charm. Within last few updates first it started just ‚Äúforgetting‚Äù any of my recent addresses, even when i exit the directions briefly while fueling, once im back in the app the address just disappears, i was kinda living with that but since today the app keeps freezing every 30-45 seconds and it takes another 5-10 to unfreeze, and while running in background sometimes it just exits the navigation mode on itself.. i know at least 3 more truckers with same issues, our work depends on this app and its sad to see it going downhill.

Update: after few weeks having to rely on imaps google seems to be back to working properly finally.

title: Reliability No Longer There
text: This app use to be great just enter from and to locations, hit start, and presto turn by turn voice directions. Now after the update I get an annoying ad for Lyft of all things (if I‚Äôm driving and need directions why in the world would I need Lyft or U er?). Next once I am able to get to where I need to be once I hit start it no longer goes to voice turn by turn navigation (and before anyone asks it has access and yes my Bluetooth is totally off when in use). I understand google wanting to create revenue but do what most do and have a quick pop up in the beginning (that can be x-ed out of) once it is done goes away and get rid of that static ad nightmare that currently resides on a quarter of my screen. Also bring back the turn by turn voice and usage reliability. Thanks.

title: Seems silly not to have multiple destinations.
text: I‚Äôve been driving for work for about 20 years now and remember when Gps navigation was new. I bought this brand new program called Microsoft streets and trips with a usb GPS receiver for my laptop. It was awesome! Showed my current speed, laptop screen was huge and easy to see and best of all, I could add multiple stops to create a route. Most of us could use this on a dedicated shopping day let alone for work. As much as I love Google maps as my navigation of choice, I really wish it would catch up with features that have been available for years elsewhere. If this is currently an option and I‚Äôm just dumb, then please make it dummy friendly and easier to use. Otherwise, great work!

title: Need additional options to avoid
text:
I use Google Maps for most of our travels. We travel by pickup pulling a fifth wheel. I always compare Google to whatever is showing on our truck‚Äôs GPS and generally reroute to match Google Maps. However, today when I did that, Google Maps put us on an unpaved road going over a very steep and curvy mountain. What a white-knuckle ride!! Very scary. After arriving at our destination, we found out that even most locals avoid that road and in winter, it doesn‚Äôt even get plowed! Thank goodness it‚Äôs June. We also found out that if we had been pulled over by the police, we could have faced a $10,000 fine! 

There needs to be an option to avoid unpaved roads. This is not the first time we wound up on unpaved roads during our travels.

title: I get lost without it!
text: I rely on Google Maps whenever I get in the car to go someplace. It is save me so much time avoiding traffic congestion I cannot even calculate how much. Only one glitch I encountered I had put in multiple stops and I decided not to stop at the first stop and kept driving to the second stop but the map turned me around and brought me back to the first stop. I was going down the highway and all the sudden it just told me to take a turn I reacted in an hour later I arrived at my first stop. It would be nice if they could add a warning that you missed your first stop or a stop with a large enough button to click to override that. 5 1/2 years it‚Äôs always got me there on time.

title: New update ‚Äúcommute‚Äù feature is trash
text:
The new feature lacks customizability. Can‚Äôt set different times for each day you go to work. Can‚Äôt have different locations you commute to regularly. Like, I go to school 5 days a week but then I go to work 3 of those days (and at different times each of those days). The feature doesn‚Äôt allow me to use school as my commuting destination without setting school as my work location. With the previous version, you could easily look at the most common places you drive to, tap on the one you want to drive to, and go. Now, you can‚Äôt. I like the idea of the commute feature to automatically set your destination at set times throughout the week, but it‚Äôs far from useful for someone like me who goes to different places at different times regularly throughout the week. 
Other than that, the app is great üëçüèº

title: I‚Äôm only a kid so this is what I do!!
text: I‚Äôm only a child, so I don‚Äôt really need google maps. However, I am one who loves history, exploring the earth. I zoom in entirely into a part of Ireland, and try to make my way to Japan (with zooming out to see where I am every once in a while of course.) Honestly? When I am bored, I just view random neighborhoods and places in other countries!! I even view my old houses I have lived in!! I just search up my recent address that I just moved away from, and boom!! There is my trampoline and car!! My mom uses it to navigate our new town and country, I use is for entertainment. My dad.... idek.üòÇüòÇ ANYWAYS- a useful app for useful things, to get to places, to navigate distant locations... great app.üòÅüòÅ

title: Gift for my husband
text: It was my husband‚Äôs first time to Nevada. I read up on about three helicopter tour companies. Papillion had great reviews and a good price. I accidentally booked the wrong day and the staff was very accommodating in switching us to the correct day. The tour van guide who picked my husband up from the hotel had us laughing so hard. He was very entertaining. My husband is still on cloud nine from the tour. The pilot took a picture with him and was very nice. We stayed in Vegas but it was truly the highlight of his trip. He is from another country and I have seen the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam. For him to experience a treasure of our country made me so happy and Papillion helped this dream come true.

title: Toll Roads
text: I specifically chose no tolls because I would rather drive 10 more minutes than spend $5+ to drive on a road, but google maps took us on a toll road anyways and I think they should be held responsible because I did my job by clicking no tolls and they didn‚Äôt hold their end of the deal. I also don‚Äôt appreciate the automatic route change if you don‚Äôt click the button in 10 seconds like I‚Äôm sorry I don‚Äôt wanna focus on my phone when driving. If I don‚Äôt click, just assume I want to stick to the original route I chose. I also hate when they use cardinal directions when I‚Äôm trying to drive like ‚Äúhead east‚Äù great thanks now I gotta think extra while trying to focus on the road and traffic. I‚Äôm never using this again I‚Äôll stick with Waze. They don‚Äôt try to scam you by rerouting you onto toll roads.

title: Offline Mode No Longer Works
text:
I use maps all the time on vacation and while in low coverage areas like on road trips. The fact that Offline Maps no longer seem to work is almost dangerous. This needs to be fixed. 

For example, I downloaded much of the Vancouver area on a trip from Seattle to Vancouver where I wouldn‚Äôt have international cell coverage. When I was in the No-coverage area and I went to bring up the downloaded area so I could find where to go, the map couldn‚Äôt load. I had to find Wi-Fi and start navigation from having data before then driving to my destination.

The same has happened on vacation in Mexico and Japan and this is dangerous. If I can‚Äôt rely on this or there‚Äôs some new limitation, it should be made more clear.

title: Thanks google for letting people give public experiences
text: Thanks google for leback knowledge and experience from places I visited! Gives me the opportunity to help the people and community with real knowledge and experience to help u when visiting! Of the good and bad! Being bold, sincere and frankly is what keeps me going! At times I get it wrong because of someone else‚Äôs jealousy or hate on people! But I include all that! Thank you GOOGLE AND GOOGLE TEAM!! SINCERELY JORGE MARTINEZ Google maps are awesome! If I get lost, it reroutes me! It gives me three different route options! Gives me information about the area! But I wouldn‚Äôt and don‚Äôt like if google uses and abuses its power to attack and terrorize people! Just like I wouldn‚Äôt like it from any other !

title: Photo access request is misleading
text: In addition to business profiles I manage mixing with my personal map preferences - so I can‚Äôt leave work at work - this app, and other google apps, provide the option to give access only to ‚Äòselect photos‚Äô, but then will not function unless I change the access to ‚Äòall photos‚Äô. I see no reason to require access to my entire photo library, in order for me to publish an image on a business profile. I see no reason google apps should ever *only* work *if* granted access to your entire photo library. I‚Äôm using an iPhone, I have a consumer right to use their photo library. If I wanted a google phone I would get one. The app shouldn‚Äôt require far more access than it‚Äôs functions could warrant. Why even provide the option for select access, if choosing that option doesn‚Äôt allow me to upload any images at all?

title: Best cosmetic dentist In Myrtle Beach
text:
Doctor Pournaras on 38 and Oleander is hands down the best . I had beautiful porcelain veneers done several years ago. I never had a minutes problem. Unfortunately, I had to have a medical procedure and the anesthesiologist from Charlotte, NC broke two of my veneers. Not a chipped tooth but broken! Doctor Pournarus is fixing some other hurried procedure that is resulting into a pretty big undertaking not to mention costly. Thank you Doctor Pournaras and your staff for getting me in really fast and calming me down. Doctor Pournaras and his staff are all professional and know the newest procedures. Pricing is very fair and insurance is accepted if applicable to procedure. 
I can not give enough kudos and accolades .

title: Google Maps on Apple CarPlay needs serious work
text:
1. The loading speed of this app while connected to Apple CarPlay is unbelievable. It takes 30+ seconds to switch between apps because of this app (it wasn‚Äôt a problem before when I was using Apple maps). It slows down all of the other apps in the background and caused some of them to shut down. 

2. The map navigation kept talking while I was using the phone app to make a call through the car. The other person kept hearing my directions in their ear. 

3. I was driving on the freeway through downtown LA when the app shut down on me. I was on a junction between three freeways when it suddenly closed itself and I had to guess which freeway to take. I‚Äôm lucky that I know the area, but if a tourist was using this app, they‚Äôd be lost and late. A detour in downtown can result in 20+ minutes of lost time. Also, the app kept trying to navigate me to a new location every time it shut it self down. When I reopen the app, it would take me to a different place than the most recent location. 

I love google maps for traveling on vacation or just whenever it‚Äôs not plugged into my car, but it‚Äôs just unusable for me when I drive, which is 95% of the time when I use the app. I really hope fixes are made because it‚Äôs a good app and I‚Äôd like to move back from Apple maps.

title: My favorite
text: Google maps have carried me around southeast Texas and parts of California for years.  I do not leave my house without checking Houston traffic conditions using Google maps. Thank goodness for this work they do!  I find the clarity of the directions priceless.  Occasionally the voice is behind on calling turns in a timely manner but 95% of the time the direction is given in time to get into the right lanes.  I wouldn‚Äôt mind a new setting that says ‚ÄúAvoid Highways‚Äù just so occasional I can take a road less traveled.  Also, there has been years of construction on the freeway near my home.  Poor Google voice used to get the ‚Äòhiccups‚Äô when I traveled it.  She still loses placement sometimes but those events are understood given the construction.  Use it!!!

title: Consistent! Can we get a negative review option?
text: I‚Äôm a highly satisfied google maps user. However, truck drivers everywhere could really use a negative review option. Not to promote negativity but to really hold shippers and receivers accountable. We don‚Äôt get paid for all hours worked. If shippers and receivers could see how dissatisfied we are with how long they keep us docked against our will, it could prompt them to make a change for the better. Please consider this. I work for free at facilities who don‚Äôt care about getting me out of there sooner so I can get back to work. They need to know they‚Äôre costing our businesses money when we clearly make them money hand over fist. üòñ. Help my favorite app.

title: Up until recently was 5 stars
text: I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going on, but for over a month now my ‚Äúsaved‚Äù and ‚Äústarred‚Äù places are not showing up when I go to search for an address.   This is a HUGE problem and takes me forever to try to locate the address which I can only do by looking on map and trying to remember where they live and then I can see my labeled/saved place on the map.    Please fix this ASAP!   I always (daily) check that my apps are updated to latest version and my iOS is always current too.      From Googling I have found this is issue for many people and that the workarounds to try to remedy it are a huge hassle and not a fix at all.      Please fix this Google.  I‚Äôll change my review when this is fixed.

title: Not sure how you get worse over time
text:
Google maps used to absolutely be the best gps program no questions asked. I don‚Äôt know what the folks in development are experimenting with, but this app got notability worse within the last year. I irony is that I undownloaded Apple Maps because it started getting worse for the same reason. DO. NOT. FIX. SOMETHING. THAT. ISN‚ÄôT. BROKEN. 

So let me be clear, BOTH Google maps and Apple Maps have gotten substantially worse within the last year. But Apple Maps has NEVER lead me to the WRONG location. It may give the the worst possible route, but Google it is shameful that you basically are the internet and you still have a GPS that can lead you to the wrong side of town. Deleting this app, and I encourage if others have had this experience to leave reviews, because it‚Äôs clear that Google is falsifying these ratings.

title: The ladies at the front WOW
text: So the two lovely women at the front desk Eleanor and Rizia where amazing and such big helps in a situation that needed special attention which they were more than willing to accommodate. These two ladies are priceless and motel 6 should count their Lucky stars that they manage to keep ahold  of these two and be extra thankful they haven‚Äôt gotten headhunted by another establishment in need of bosses like these two. And trust me every other establishment need these two incredible women because just having them on staff will send their company stock through the roof. I will definitely stay at this motel 6 in Vacaville again no doubt. This is coming from a surprisingly thrilled to be satisfied customer.

title: Struggling
text: I use maps for my job every day. In most urban areas Google finds locations. In rural or country areas google struggles. Often if you follow to where it says a address is you may find you are nowhere near it. Just the other day when I heard you have arrived I had passed the home about two miles earlier. Google often takes you to the center of a road and says you have arrived. I would rather the service be honest and say it can‚Äôt find it. I am starting to rely more on Apple Maps and/or Here We Go. After this latest update when I click to go home it tells me it can‚Äôt find it. Need update to fix this fast Google. I still try to use Google because it used to be more reliable. Google keeps adding more features when most people just need to get where they are going.

title: Shuts off randomly, freezes, wrong lanes
text:
Over the last few months it has been shutting off randomly or freezing about 5 times per day. Deleting and re-downloading did not help, and my iOS is up to date. 

Also it doesn‚Äôt understand the right lane merges in the freeways in Columbus OH, and the voice doesn‚Äôt match the map so then you end up being in too early of a turn lane if you listen to the voice. The indicator that tells you which lane to be in also matches the voice and not the map and doesn‚Äôt take into account the many right lane merges directly before an exit that happens very frequently in Columbus OH. I have gotten lost every single time I have used the app driving on the freeways of Columbus near Worthington, Easton, and downtown during the last few months. It also doesn‚Äôt understand there has been construction near the highway leading to Easton and so the lanes are just completely incorrect.

title: Going Downhill
text: I‚Äôve religiously used Google Maps (and still do) for so many years now. I love so much about it, especially the timeline feature, up until recently. I‚Äôm not quite sure what has happened but it seems as though Maps gets my timeline correct about 20 percent of the time now. It has me going to places I‚Äôve never been and once it has me at a random house like two blocks away for 24 hours. I‚Äôve tried everything besides deleting and redownloading so that‚Äôs what I‚Äôm doing now. I really hope this gets fixed soon. I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs the app itself or IOS but either way I hope that it improves as this the beat navigation app in my opinion. The only other qualm I have is the ‚ÄòNESW‚Äô directions. ‚ÄòHead North‚Äô isn‚Äôt always the easiest thing to understand (or maybe I‚Äôm just dumb ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è).

title: Better than other map apps
text: Big advantage over others is that you can set the volume level of voice-over within app settings independent of phone‚Äôs overall volume. If you‚Äôve ever been on a long road trip, letting the the map run in the background while you listened to an audiobook, music, news or sports, then had the map interrupt at such a starkly diff volume it literally made everyone jump and cover their ears while you fumbled frantically for the volume, then you know how big a deal this is. Google map lets you adjust map VO relative to the other apps at low, med, or high with an in-app setting. Overall device volume still controlled the usual way.  THANK-YOU GOOGLE FOR FIELD TESTING!!!!!

title: Great Care
text: In my experience at the Holistic Dental Center, I found the atmosphere to be extremely professional and warm. The Dentest and nurses are fully knowledgeable in all areas of the latest and most effective holistic healing practices known to date. In a short time of following the easygoing instructions given, I surprisingly seen immediate corrective results. I wish I had known about this Dental Center years ago. I would recommend them to anyone that wants to start there corrective dental healing from the inside out. Food for thought, our smile is the first representative for our presence. So we should always become the best representative we can be. The Holistic Dental Center in my opinion is a no brained. Keep up the great work üëçüèΩ.

title: Benjamin Howard
text: The first time I entered Perry Homes Peter Johnson took the lead and pointed out the ends and outs of Perry Homes and I was impressed.  He showed me the home that was being built and I made the purchase of said home.  He walked me through the process and kept me updated on the progress.  Once I moved in he continued to follow up and whenever there was a problem or an issue he contacted the necessary people to make the corrections.  I have been in the property for a month and a half and he is still in constant contact just to make sure everything is working properly.  I would recommend Peter Johnson to anyone that‚Äôs in the market for purchasing a Perry Home.

title: Review
text:
I don‚Äôt know what you guys did to the app but it is absolutely terrible! The last year, I can have the GPS going and not be moving. Google will freak out ‚Äúturn left on Main Street, continue on north Main Street, turn left on Main Street, turn left on north Main Street‚Äù and it continuously does his until I either move or turn off the GPS! This has been happening on iPhone 6S, 7, 8, X, and my fianc√©‚Äôs multiple androids! It‚Äôs obviously a problem on googles end. 

Today I missed an exit because of google and added 10 minutes to the drive. I knew I was getting close to my exit but put my faith into google that it would tell me. Wrong move. I unlocked my phone and it immediately says, ‚ÄúTurn on exit 100 in 450 feet‚Äù... while I‚Äôm three lanes over. Missed exit. The state of google maps is a joke compared to a few years ago. I have been against Apple maps since they came out but am reconsidering lately.

title: Latest Update Is Not Good
text: The latest update has made the app not very friendly with the iPhoneX. When searching for directions it allows you to swipe to get back to the home screen or multitask to another app. However, when it is navigating this function is completely unusable. To get back to the home screen you have to swipe down from the top, move to another app, and then swipe up to go home. If it was designed that way to prevent using your phone while navigating then it was overthought and a bit too big brotherish. I certainly don‚Äôt need Google deciding how I should use my phone while driving. Also, I often use Maps as a passenger to help a driver navigate. I also use it frequently when walking in larger cities I travel to. I am hoping that this issue gets fixed soon so I don‚Äôt have to look for an alternative Maps program.

title: Great navigation... Only if you have unlimited data
text:
Minus 2 stars because the app forgets the original route when I'm going out of wifi area without data service, and GMaps attempts to reroute. This may change an originally toll-free route to a toll one - all without notice! 

Also, when out on the road and cellular data is off, and then I turn data on, the app takes at least 30 seconds before reconnecting/rerouting. This issue is very problematic when I'm Turing data briefly on to search for coffee/gas-stations along the route.

Another issue is that the app consumes too much data - probably from downloading pictures associated with Point Of Interest's. My monthly data usage usually goes up to 70 MB's, and 100MB's for each roadtrips. It would be great if there's an option to reduce data usage for pictures.

title: Rockport wal mart optical
text: I‚Äôm from Arkansas and my husband and I winter here 2-3 times a year. 5 months ago, we were here and my metal frame glasses broke in the middle. My lens are progressive trifocals so wear the continually. I came to your optical. A lady with long grey hair waited on me. She told me they couldn‚Äôt fix my glasses because they needed to be sauntered. She offered to see if she could find some frames that would fit my lenses. She found a pair that fit perfectly. She‚Äôs a very kind , helpful and a pleasure to visit with. I have kept these frames even though I had a warranty on my wire frames. Your employee is very good in optical knowledge and very very interested in taking care of customers ‚ù£Ô∏è

title: Google employees to dumb to drive can‚Äôt make a good app for directions
text:
Once back about 2 years ago I took a road trip to Ohio, we got to a rural area and there wasn‚Äôt much in the way of service so we stopped at a little carry out to get some directions. It was 1:30 in the afternoon and there was this old man who was drunk, and I mean drunk. He had red eyes and slured every word. Would you believe he was still more clear and concise then this app has ever been when it came to telling me where to go? This bad app can‚Äôt even load a proper route and holy Christ can you stupid goobers at google put a setting for commercial vehicles in I don‚Äôt think it would be to hard, but then again I‚Äôm sure you wieners dont even drive cars (you are mentally slow). 

Well anyway I hate you google I hope you all burn thank you. 

-Alexander

title: Does what it needs to be with frequent annoyance
text:
The app is pretty good at getting you from point a to b but there are quite a few small annoying things that remain constantly annoying:

1. The connecting modes things. If I want to take public transit I want public transit not Uber or a bike, super annoying to have to disable it every single time I want to use public transit

2. Music sometimes stops on Apple car play. Sometimes if google maps gives instructions too close together it stops any other audio I was playing in the car which is annoying.

3. Public transit can be inconsistent. I find that it will give me wildly different routes to places based on tiny differences like a few minutes.

4. Walking in public transit. I‚Äôm not sure why but I can‚Äôt figure out how it wants me to figure out how to walk to stations. I always have to do live view, then cancel that, to get walking instructions for a leg of the trip.

Good app but has potential to be better if google just fixes annoying user experience stuff some of which wouldn‚Äôt be that hard. Give me an option to permanently disable connecting modes like bikes for example.
